main event: An unidentified flying object was observed near Hamilton, California on August 21, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as a round clear silver object the size of a baseball and was observed at approximately 20,000 feet., The UFO exhibited climbing and dropping behavior while following a straight path., The sighting lasted ten minutes and was occasionally obscured by jet contrails., The object was first seen against the contrail of a B-47 jet and was visually tracked by the radar observer in an F-89D., The report later suggested that the object could potentially be a balloon launched from Vernalis, California.
witness description: two reliable second lieutenants from the 84th Fighter Interceptor Squadron, including a pilot and a radar observer
